intro: Chrysobotrya, commonly known as the yellow-flowered heath, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. These plants are native to South Africa, where they typically grow in rocky or sandy soils. Chrysobotrya species are characterized by their small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. They often have evergreen foliage and are adapted to thrive in dry, nutrient-poor environments. The genus includes several species, each with unique floral structures and growth habits.
